trans-unit.source: Step 3: Transform the X12 850 PO Message to the ORDERS05 Message
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Transform the X12 850 PO Message to the ORDERS05 Message

trans-unit.source: Both the X12 850 schemas and ORDERS05 schemas are pretty complex and require functional expertise in the respective domains to understand and create maps between the two schemas.
trans-unit.target: Both the X12 850 schemas and ORDERS05 schemas are pretty complex and require functional expertise in the respective domains to understand and create maps between the two schemas.

trans-unit.source: While you already generated the schema for ORDERS05 IDOC, you can get the schema for X12 PO message (X12_00401_850.xsd) from the <embeddedLabel>MicrosoftEdiXSDTemplates.zip</embeddedLabel> that you previously downloaded and extracted.
trans-unit.target: While you already generated the schema for ORDERS05 IDOC, you can get the schema for X12 PO message (X12_00401_850.xsd) from the <embeddedLabel>MicrosoftEdiXSDTemplates.zip</embeddedLabel> that you previously downloaded and extracted.

trans-unit.source: You must add the <embeddedLabel>X12_00401_850.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema to the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> project.
trans-unit.target: You must add the <embeddedLabel>X12_00401_850.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema to the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> project.

trans-unit.source: Creating a <token>transform</token> between the X12 850 PO and ORDERS05 PO requires functional domain knowledge of both the X12 schema and the ORDERS05 schema.
trans-unit.target: Creating a <token>transform</token> between the X12 850 PO and ORDERS05 PO requires functional domain knowledge of both the X12 schema and the ORDERS05 schema.

trans-unit.source: Only then one can identify which field in the X12 schema maps to which field in the ORDERS05 schema.
trans-unit.target: Only then one can identify which field in the X12 schema maps to which field in the ORDERS05 schema.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we do not get into such details and instead use an existing <token>transform</token> (<embeddedLabel>AzureTransformations.trfm</embeddedLabel>) between these two schemas.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we do not get into such details and instead use an existing <token>transform</token> (<embeddedLabel>AzureTransformations.trfm</embeddedLabel>) between these two schemas.

trans-unit.source: This <token>transform</token> is available in the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> project that you can download from the <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=241990</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This <token>transform</token> is available in the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> project that you can download from the <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=241990</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: To include the transform in the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, right-click the project name, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Existing Items</embeddedLabel>, and then navigate to the location where you downloaded the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> sample from the MSDN Code Gallery.
trans-unit.target: To include the transform in the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, right-click the project name, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Existing Items</embeddedLabel>, and then navigate to the location where you downloaded the <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel> sample from the MSDN Code Gallery.
